com.gl.vn.me.ko.pies.platform.server.rest

Class RestServer<T extends RestRequestHandlerResult>

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.gl.vn.me.ko.pies.platform.server.tcp.TcpServer
      • com.gl.vn.me.ko.pies.platform.server.rest.RestServer<T>
  • Type Parameters:
    T - Type of RestRequestHandlerResult applicable for the RestServer.
    All Implemented Interfaces:
    Server
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    JsonRestServer

    @ThreadSafe
public class RestServer<T extends RestRequestHandlerResult>
extends TcpServer
    A REST HTTP over TCP implementation of the Server interface.

    The RestServer responds with HTTP responses of version HttpVersion.HTTP_1_1 and the following HTTP status codes:

    • 100 Continue if HTTP request contains "Expect: 100-continue" header.
    • 400 Bad Request if HTTP request doesn't represent a correct RestRequest, if there is no suitable RestRequestHandler to handle a request, if content of HTTP request can't be correctly decoded, if BindingNotFoundException was thrown while handling a RestRequest, if BadRestRequestException was thrown while handling a RestRequest (this part MAY be changed by overriding handleException(Throwable, HttpRequest) method).
    • 408 Request Timeout if TimeoutException was thrown while handling a RestRequest (MAY be changed by overriding handleException(Throwable, HttpRequest) method)
    • 500 Internal Server Error if any other unhandled Throwable was thrown while handling an HTTP request (MAY be changed by overriding handleException(Throwable, HttpRequest) method), e.g. if RestRequestHandler throws an RestRequestHandlingException while handling a RestRequest.
    • Any other status code specified by RestRequestHandlerResult.

    • Constructor Detail

      • RestServer

        @Inject
public RestServer(@RestServerAddress
                          InetSocketAddress address,
                          @RestServerName
                          String name,
                          @RestServerBoss
                          Integer maxBossThreads,
                          @RestServerWorker
                          Integer maxWorkerThreads,
                          @RestServerRequestHandling
                          Integer maxPostResponseWorkerThreads,
                          @RestServerThreadFactory
                          ThreadFactory threadFactory,
                          @RestServerBoss @Nullable
                          ChannelInitializer<ServerSocketChannel> serverSocketChannelInitializer,
                          @RestServerRequestHandling @Nullable
                          Collection<? extends RestRequestHandler<? extends T>> restHandlers)
        Constructs a new instance of RestServer.
        Parameters:
        address - An InetSocketAddress the RestServer will listen to.
        name - A name of the RestServer.
        maxBossThreads - Maximum number of Threads that accept new TCP connections.
        maxWorkerThreads - Maximum number of Threads that process data received via the accepted TCP connections.
        maxPostResponseWorkerThreads - Maximum number of Threads that handle REST requests by using restHandlers.
        threadFactory - A ThreadFactory that will be used to create boss, worker and REST request handler Threads. Thread names MAY not be the same as the threadFactory generates.
        serverSocketChannelInitializer - A ChannelInitializer that will be used to initialize a ServerSocketChannel that is bound to the address. If this argument is null then default ChannelInitializer , that adds a LoggingHandler with LogLevel.DEBUG, will be used.
        restHandlers - RestRequestHandlers that will be used to handle REST requests. Each RestRequestHandler can only be associated with a single instance of RestServer.

    • Method Detail

      • createServiceHttpResponse

        protected FullHttpResponse createServiceHttpResponse(HttpResponseStatus httpResponseStatus,
                                                     @Nullable
                                                     String httpReasonPhrase)
        Creates a new HTTP response that will be used by RestServer when there is no RestRequestHandlerResult available.

        Subclasses MAY override this method. This method MUST support concurrent invocations. Version of the returned HTTP response MUST be HttpVersion.HTTP_1_1.

        Default implementation in RestServer constructs the simplest HTTP response with "Content-Type" "text/plain" and Constant.CHARSET Charset.

        Parameters:
        httpResponseStatus - An HTTP status code.
        httpReasonPhrase - An HTTP reason phrase.
        Returns:
        A new HTTP response.

      • handleException

        protected FullHttpResponse handleException(Throwable e,
                                           @Nullable
                                           HttpRequest httpRequest)
        Handles uncaught Throwables.
        Parameters:
        e - A Throwable occurred while processing httpRequest. MAY also be an ExternallyVisibleException, a BadRestRequestException, a TimeoutException.
        httpRequest - An HttpRequest that caused the Throwable e.
        Returns:
        A FullHttpResponse that will be responded as a result of the uncaught Throwable e. This response MUST be created via the createServiceHttpResponse(HttpResponseStatus, String) method.

      • shutdownHook

        protected final void shutdownHook()
        Description copied from class: TcpServer
        Subclasses MAY implement this method in order to perform shutdown actions; this implementation does nothing. This method is called from the TcpServer.shutdown() method and MAY be not idempotent.
        Overrides:
        shutdownHook in class TcpServer
